did.langmaterial: The material is in English; selected items are in Polish.
did.abstract: Binkowski was a district judge from Warren, Michigan who collected extensively about Democratic politics and the Polish American community in Michigan. The collection includes materials collected by Binkowski on Democratic politics, the Polish community in Michigan, the cities of Detroit, Warren, and Hamtramck, Michigan, and collected letters, postage covers, and stamps.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Judge Don Binkowski (donor no. 5501) and came to the library in 1974. Periodic additions have been received.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Don Binkowski transferred his copyright to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Don Binkowski collected materials, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Don Binkowski was born October 26, 1929 in Detroit, Michigan. He received his B.A. from the University of Michigan in 1951 and his LL.B. from Wayne State University in 1956. Following graduation, he worked for the Allstate Insurance Company as a casualty examiner (1956-1957), as assistant attorney general (1957-1959), as department officer in the office of the Michigan Department of State (1959-1960), with the Wayne County Friend of Court (1960-1961), as a delegate to the Michigan Constitutional Convention (1961-1962), and as a member of the Michigan Labor Mediation Board (1962-1963).
In addition to private practice in the city of Warren, Binkowski has served on the Warren City Council, (mayor pro tem 1965-1968) and as Judge of the 37th District Court in Warren (1969-1986).
Proud of his Polish heritage, Binkowski has been both a historian and a collector of historical materials relating to the contribution of Polish-Americans.

arrangement.p: The Don Binkowski collected materials collection has been arranged into the following series: Polish American files; Politics; Michigan History; Miscellaneous; Photographs; and Sound recordings.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes materials collected by Binkowski on Democratic politics, the Polish community in Michigan, the cities of Detroit, Warren, and Hamtramck, Michigan history in general, and collected letters, postage covers, and stamps. Digital materials include video files and an archived website. Photographs include images of strike violence, 1934-1938, at various Michigan firms; photos of Polish American public figures and organizations, also photos of political meetings and elected officials. Audio cassettes mostly contain recorded interviews with Polish American political figures.

The Polish American files (4.5 linear feet) includes items collected by Binkowski on Polish American organizations, Polonia and the Polish American community in Detroit, Polish politicians in Michigan, and notable members of the Polish community including Stanislaw Rys. Of note is a file on Ted Kaczynski, known as the "Unabomber," containing correspondence between Binkowski and Kaczynski. The series also includes collections on Polish churches in Detroit. Digital content (382 MB) includes a video for Stanislaw Rys's celebration of life service. Additional material on Polish politicians can be found in the Politics series.

scopecontent.p: The Politics series (2.5 linear feet) includes items collected by Binkowski on Michigan politics and politicians. A substantial portion of this series is devoted to Polish politicians including Thaddeus Machrowicz, John Sosnowski (member of U.S. Congress), and Anthony Wilkowski. Items include political advertisements and press clippings. Photographs are scattered throughout this series as indicated. Digital content (6.2 GB) includes video of a 1984 Democratic Party dinner honoring Ralph Liberato. Related materials can be found in the Polish American files.

did.unittitle: Derezinski, Anthony A. (Democratic Party primary candidate for U.S. Senate, 1978) 1974-1977
Lesinski, John, Sr. (member of US Congress) 1932-1944
Lesinski, John, Jr. (member of US Congress) undated

scopecontent.p: The Michigan History series (5 linear feet) is arranged by the following subseries: Bicentennial; Detroit; Hamtramck; Warren; and Miscellaneous. Items in the series. The Bicentennial subseries consists of press clippings about Michigan's bicentennial and Polish community's involvement in it. The Detroit, Hamtramck, and Warren subseries include items related to each city, including Mlody Theater programs, "Melody Theater" scripts, and local school paraphernalia. The Miscellaneous subseries includes documents related to general Michigan history and other areas of the state. Digital content (10 GB) in this series includes an archived website on the history of Warren, a video file of a 1965 short film, "Detroit: City on the Move," narrated by mayor Jerome Cavanaugh, and a series of video files on the history of the Polish American community of Hamtramck.

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous series (0.2 linear feet) includes files on notable personages and other areas of Binkowski's collecting activities, including matchbook covers.

did.unittitle: Musical Scores-"I Want to Go Back to Michigan (Down on the Farm)" and "The Little Ford Rambled Right Along," 1914

scopecontent.p: The Photographs series (0.5 linear feet) includes images related to Michigan automotive strikes in 1937-1938, Michigan Polish groups, and Michigan politicians.

did.unittitle: Hamtramck Realtors Association member gathering, circa 1920s

scopecontent.p: The Postage series (2 linear feet) includes letters, covers, stamps, and postmarks relating to Detroit, Michigan, Polish, and Polish American history. Among the letters is one written in 1886 by University of Michigan Law School student Frank Malvern Mather to his parents in Ohio.
The Sound Recordings series (2 linear feet) includes many audio cassettes, mostly of interviews with Polish American political figures.

odd.p: (mostly interviews with Polish American political figures)

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional material related to Binkowski's personal life and political career can be found in another collection titled, "Don Binkowski papers."
